newsitem.title: GERMANY: Frankfurt airport hall closed after smoke alarm.
newsitem.headline: Frankfurt airport hall closed after smoke alarm.

text.p: Hundreds of people were evacuated and one woman was slightly injured as a result of a smoke alarm at the Frankfurt international airport, airport officials said on Sunday.
Wilhelm Machleid, deputy chief of the airport fire department, told reporters that arrival terminal B was shut down after smoke was spotted coming out of the air-conditioning system.
"We carried out an evacuation immediately. Only one person was slightly injured who had inhaled smoke," he said.
Fire officials said they were still uncertain of the cause of the smoke and had not found any other sign of fire. The smoke was first noticed around 8 p.m. (1800 GMT)
Hans-Juergen Kohnert, a senior airport fire official, said it was likely that terminal B would be reopened before morning.
Just over a year ago a fire tore through the Duesseldorf airport, killing 17 people and causing millions in damages.
